channel.title: Easy peasy lemon squeezy question lol
channel.description:
ive been trying to figure out how to make shop items worth a different payment unlike money i have coin credits in my server (id 996) so is there ints i need to add somewhere or anything? put all information needed please and thank you
****MODIFY**** (same question but re-writen?) How to change the currency of a shop?
******MODIFY****** SOURCE : DDSSPECED SERVER : 317

item.description:
@CoderNexus wrote:

[quote=“merk n a box, post:8, topic:335868”]i know how to do it on a 479
go to shop defs

<shop> <name>TzHaar-Hur-Tel's Equipment Store</name> <currency>6529</currency> <npcIds> <int>2620</int> </npcIds> <defaultItems> <item> <id>6568</id> <count>100</count> </item> <item> <id>6528</id> <count>100</count> </item> <item> <id>6524</id> <count>100</count> </item> <item> <id>6523</id> <count>100</count> </item> <item> <id>6526</id> <count>100</count> </item> <item> <id>6527</id> <count>100</count> </item> <item> <id>6525</id> <count>100</count> </item> </defaultItems> </shop>
change the currency to what you want[/quote]

That works for 359+ also. Not just 479.

item.source: Easy peasy lemon squeezy question lol

item.title: Easy peasy lemon squeezy question lol
item.dc:creator: @CoderNexus CoderNexus
item.description:
@CoderNexus wrote:

Step 1: ShopHandler.java

Open up ShopHandler.java, and add this int under “public static int TotalShops”

Code:
public static int[] currency = new int[MaxShops];
Now go to “public ShopHandler() {” and directly below:

Code:
ShopName[i] = “”;
add

Code:
currency[i] = 0;

Now replace your whole loadShops method with this:

Code:
public boolean loadShops(String FileName) {
String line = “”;
String token = “”;
String token2 = “”;
String token2_2 = “”;
String[] token3 = new String[(MaxShopItems * 2)];
boolean EndOfFile = false;
int ReadMode = 0;
BufferedReader characterfile = null;
try {
characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./bin/config/"+FileName));
} catch(FileNotFoundException fileex) {
misc.println(FileName+": file not found.");
return false;
}
try {
line = characterfile.readLine();
} catch(IOException ioexception) {
misc.println(FileName+": error loading file.");
return false;
}
while(EndOfFile == false && line != null) {
line = line.trim();
int spot = line.indexOf("=");
if (spot > -1) {
token = line.substring(0, spot);
token = token.trim();
token2 = line.substring(spot + 1); // +1
token2 = token2.trim();
token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", “\t”);
token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", “\t”);
token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", “\t”);
token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", “\t”);
token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", “\t”);
token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
if (token.equals(“shop”)) {
int ShopID = Integer.parseInt(token3[0]);
ShopName[ShopID] = token3[1].replaceAll("_", " ");
currency[ShopID] = Integer.parseInt(token3[4]);
ShopSModifier[ShopID] = Integer.parseInt(token3[2]);
ShopBModifier[ShopID] = Integer.parseInt(token3[3]);

                for (int i = 0; i < ((token3.length - 5) / 2); i++) {
                    if (token3[(5 + (i * 2))] != null) {
                        ShopItems[ShopID][i] = (Integer.parseInt(token3[(5 + (i * 2))]) + 1);
                        ShopItemsN[ShopID][i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + (i * 2))]);
                        ShopItemsSN[ShopID][i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + (i * 2))]);
                        ShopItemsStandard[ShopID]++;
                    } else {
                        break;
                    }
                }
                TotalShops++;
            }
        } else {
            if (line.equals("[ENDOFSHOPLIST]")) {
                try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
                return true;
            }
        }
        try {
            line = characterfile.readLine();
        } catch(IOException ioexception1) { EndOfFile = true; }
    }
    try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
    return false;
}

What replacing it did was add the currency int while loading the shop.

Step 2: client.java

add this int:

Code:
public int currency()
{
return server.shopHandler.currency[MyShopID];
}
Now go to “public boolean sellItem” scroll down a little until you see this:

Code:
addItem(995, TotPrice2);
Replace that with:

Code:
addItem(currency(), TotPrice2);

Now search for:

shop will buy for

Something like this will come up:

Code:
CAM().sendMessage(getItemName(removeID)
+ “: shop will buy for " + ShopValue + " gp” +
+ ShopAdd);
Replace that with:

Code:
CAM().sendMessage(getItemName(removeID) + ": shop will buy for " + ShopValue + " " + getItemName(currency()) + ShopAdd);
Now scroll down a little until you see this:

Code:
CAM().sendMessage(getItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs "
Replace that line with:

Code:
CAM().sendMessage(getItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs " + ShopValue + " " + getItemName(currency()) + ShopAdd);
Now replace your “public boolean buyItem” with this

Code:
public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if ((amount > 0)
&& (itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] - 1))) {
if (amount > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot]) {
amount = server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot];
}
if (QH().q1 == 9) {
QH().q1 = 10;
CAM().sendMessage(“You found the herb!”);
}
double ShopValue;
double TotPrice;
int TotPrice2;
int Overstock;
int Slot = 0;
for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
TotPrice2 = (int) Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0,
fromSlot));
Slot = GetItemSlot(currency());
if (Slot == -1) {
CAM().sendMessage("You don’t have enough " + getItemName(currency()) + “(s).”);
break;
}
if (playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) {
if (freeSlots() > 0) {
deleteItem(currency(), GetItemSlot(currency()), TotPrice2);
addItem(itemID, 1);
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
}
} else {
CAM().sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
break;
}
} else {
CAM().sendMessage("You don’t have enough " + getItemName(currency()) + “(s).”);
break;
}
}
resetItems(3823);
resetShop(MyShopID);
UpdatePlayerShop();
return true;
}
return false;
}

Step 3: Compile, but don’t run yet!

Now that you have added this, you must put it to use.

Let’s say this is my shop:

Code:
shop = 1 Aubury’s_Rune_Store 2 2 5699 999999999
That will no longer work. You need to set currency for the shop. So, if I want the shop’s currency to be coins, I would change it to this:

Code:
shop = 1 Aubury’s_Rune_Store 2 2 995 5699 999999999
I added the number 995 because 995 is the itemID for coins. Now let’s say I want the shop’s currency to be dds’. I would change it to this:

Code:
shop = 1 Aubury’s_Rune_Store 2 2 5698 554 999999999
5698 is the itemID for a dds.

This should make it much easier to change a shop’s currency.

Also, remember that you must use the TAB button, not the space bar.

100% credit to John4593. Rep is appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy peasy lemon squeezy question lol
item.dc:creator: @CoderNexus CoderNexus
item.description:
@CoderNexus wrote:

Okay, make it more clear for me. I don’t really understand what you want. Im guessing you want to change the amount you recieve when you sell an item to a store, so this is how:

Go to your config file folder, and look for something like items.java, item.java, etc. (something that has all items in it with stats, etc.)

There should be a price for it in the 7th column (im reffering to a delta base, even though delta sucks monster cock.) Just change that to the price you want it.

If this isnt what you want, just reply.

Read full topic
